intro: Commiphora coronillifolia, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It produces a resinous sap, which has been traditionally used for incense and medicinal purposes. The plant thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
